DOC.brief_title: Quality Improvement Project - Evaluation Current Standard Care Feeding Practices NICU
DOC.detailed_description: This quality improvement project evaluate current standard care nutritional management low birth weight infant receive donor human milk product NICU Texas Children 's Hospital . There randomization , control subject , therefore probability group assignment . Infants identified dietitian staff TCH upon admission NICU ( Levels 2 3 ) communicate PI PI 's staff . For subject , data collection begin point infant first receive enteral feeding ( include trophic feed ) . All infant less equal 1250 g birth weight follow initially . If parent decline allow donor human milk product infant , note data collection additional data collect infant . If late time , parent decides allow donor human milk product , begin data collection . Our current experience > 95 % mother agree donor human milk product . Data collection continue throughout hospitalization one week donor human milk product discontinue discharge . From medical chart , record follow data weekly basis : weight , length , head circumference , lab ( Chem 10 panel - BUN , creatinine , sodium , potassium , bicarbonate , chloride , calcium , phosphorus , magnesium , glucose ) , medication , nutrition order ( parenteral enteral nutrition feed order include volume , concentration , additive ) . If abnormal nutrition-related lab note , change nutrition order record frequently weekly basis . A copy data collection template attach Section S. No lab request research purpose . No intervention part protocol . This protocol involve minimal risk individual . A waiver consent would way adversely affect privacy right welfare individual .
